greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} mu(k)^2 * 2^omega(k) where omega(k) is the number of distinct primes in the factorization of k.
reference: G. Tenenbaum and Jie Wu, Cours Spécialisés No. 2: "Théorie analytique et probabiliste des nombres", Collection SMF, Ordres moyens, p. 20.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Asymptotic formula: a(n) = C*n*log(n) + O(n) with C = Product_{p prime} (1 - 1/p)^2*(1 + 2/p).
The constant C is A065473. - _Amiram Eldar_, May 24 2020
a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} mu(k)^2*d(k), where d is the number of divisors function (A000005). - _Ridouane Oudra_, Jul 25 2019
maple: with(numtheory): seq(add(tau(k)*mobius(k)^2, k=1..n), n=1..90); # _Ridouane Oudra_, Jul 25 2019
program: (Scheme) (define (A069201 n) (if (= 1 n) n (+ (A074823 n) (A069201 (- n 1))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 23 2017
(PARI) a(n) = sum(k=1, n, moebius(k)^2*2^omega(k)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 23 2017
(MAGMA) [&+[MoebiusMu(k)^2*#Divisors(k):k in [1..n]]: n in [1..66]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Jul 27 2019
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 14 2002
